bibl.title: Letter from Wickliffe Rose to Henry Hanson, May 6, 1921

div1.p: Rose grants Hanson's request for trained sanitary inspectors. He expects cooperation with the French Army Medical Corps. He encloses an account sheet detailing conversion of currency.

div1.head: Letter from Wickliffe Rose to Henry Hanson, May 6, 1921
div1.opener:
copy
R
Trujillo
May 6, 1921
Dear Doctor Hanson:
div1.p:
ARRIVED DATE SEEN ONE TYPICAL YELLOW
FEVER STOP AM REORGANIZING AND INTENSI-
FYING WORK HOPE NOT TO HAVE GENERAL
EPIDEMIC THIS DEPARTMENT

The detailed estimate for the campaign
has not yet arrived.

After receiving your cable of April 26,
we wired Colonel Fisher to ask if he could lend the
services of two trained sanitary inspectors to assist
you in Peru for three or four months, over the present
critical period. We received a favorable reply from
him yesterday. We have today asked him to send either
Pickett and Corrigan or Pickett and Bumiller to Salaverry.
Doctor Henry Hanson
May 6, 1921
2.
by the first boat. With this added assistance we hope
that you can carry out the energetic program that is
needed.

Doctor Carter advises us that Pickett
and Corrigan were paid $400 per month and expenses last
season. We assume that you will make a similiar arrange-
ment with them this year. We are placing at their dis-
posal $500, of which they are to use as much as may be
needed for their travelling expenses to Salaverry.

We note with interest the helpful coopera-
tion you are receiving from Colonel Vergne from the French
Army Medical Corps. If you have occasion, please express
to him, on behalf of the Board, our appreciation of his
help.

We are glad that the newspaper opposition
is letting up. I am enclosing copy of a letter going for-
ward today to Doctor Cardenas in response to his request
for more vaccine and serum. You will notice what we said
to combat any impression he may have with reference to sub-
stituting vaccination for stegomyia control.

We do not want you to slacken your efforts
Doctor Henry Hanson
May 6, 1921
3.
on account of lack of funds and count on you to keep
us fully informed of your needs, by cable when necessary.
We expect you to use government funds as far as they are
obtainable then call on us, keeping us informed of your
needs sufficiently in advance to prevent any lapses of
work.

We have confidence in your energetic and
thorough management of the campaign in Peru. It is a
satisfaction to know that you are on the ground.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, (Signed) Wickliffe Rose Doctor Henry Hanson
Direccion de la Campana Sanitaria
Contra la Fiebre Amarilla on los
Departamentos del Norte
Chiclayo, Peru
